website_summaries.verdict: Well-built polarizing lens filter that will give you the high performance you're seeking in all outdoor shooting conditions.
pros: Mid-range price, so you aren't going to break the bank with this model
Versatile filter that has options to fit lens threads ranging from 28 mm to 86 mm
You'll have no problems making quick adjustments to this filter while you're in the middle of a photo shoot
Should deliver accurate colors in most shooting conditions
cons: Some customers report problems with removing the filter after using it because of issues with the threads

customer_reviews.title: Great and cheap polarizer
customer_reviews.text: I use it with a canon rebel SL1 and it works great. it adds a little saturation to your pictures and help you removing or adding sun reflection on water which is really cool. I post edit all my pictures so this is a little add on while taking photography but I really like this product and it is very easy to use. I would definitely recommend it if like me, you like shooting landscapes and sunsets. If you found this helpful, please click yes :)
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Need a Circular Polarizer? Tiffen gots your back!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used this with my 35mm f/1.4 E-Mount . By far, this polarizer has not came off my lens when i took it out for travelling to Hawaii. It gave my shots more contrast, darkens the highlights to the point where I can use the image and of course, see through reflections. As a polarizer, it does what most polarizers do, I definitely would recommend this filter! Highlights: - Tiffen helps with maintaining the sharpness - Blocks reflections - Ups the contrasts in your shots and reduces highlights
customer_reviews.author: BrotherKehn

customer_reviews.title: My TIffen polarizer was a great filter, keeping out the nasty glare and protecting ...
customer_reviews.text: My TIffen polarizer was a great filter, keeping out the nasty glare and protecting my lens. And then the kid dropped the camera out of the bag....BANG, right on the lens cap. As I pulled the cap off, I could see the filter was smashed, but did it protect the lens?? YES. Very happy customer here. The filter did its job both while filming, and to protect the lens of the camera during a fall. Very happy, and I've already ordered a replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Roger Meeker

customer_reviews.title: Wishing I would have bought the $80 filter
customer_reviews.text: I got this filter because I was going to Italy and knew I would run into glare issues with paintings behind glass. This filter was basically useless. I could not get rid of glare at all no matter how much time I took to manipulate it and dial things in. I saw some reviews that said it was useless and took my chances. Pay the money for a good quality filter. This is not it. Unfortunately, you never know if reviews are planted by competitors. This is MY opinion, unsolicited and uncompensated.
customer_reviews.author: Steven J. Blanas

customer_reviews.title: Cheap price. Cheap quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is a review for the Tiffen 58MM Circular Polarizer Glass Filter. Tiffen filters are generally very cheap and this one clearly shows it. It will degrade image quality and might cause flares in your images because the coatings are very cheap. Try it yourself. See if you can see your reflection in the filter or try reflecting some light. How does it compare with other filters? Instead, go for the B+W or Hoya filters. They are much pricier, but much better quality. You get what you pay for.
customer_reviews.author: Robert.

customer_reviews.title: Great Filter!
customer_reviews.text: This filter is great quality! Once screwed on, the filter rotates freely on itself for adjustment of polarization. It is pretty durable, too, since I've already dropped it a few times and it survived. The pictures provided start with the filter at the "lowest" setting, then around the middle, and then the maximum polarization. It does a great job with glass and reflections!
customer_reviews.author: emass24Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent filter!
customer_reviews.text: During the summer I almost always have a polarizer on most of my lenses. In Colorado the sunlight is super intense and this helps even things out. I have other Tiffen products and i think they are the correct intersection of value and quality. These aren't the cheapest filters, but neither are they junk or expensive either. This is a sound investment in your photography and you won't cry if you scratch, break or lose one.
customer_reviews.author: KayakFisherman

customer_reviews.title: Affordable, well built, and did exactly what I ...
customer_reviews.text: Affordable, well built, and did exactly what I needed it to do, bring back some details to my photos. Small downside (not related to the product itself) but if you're using this on top of an UV filter at a wide angle shot, you might catch the edge of the filter lens into your photos because of the added lens width... so heed of caution there
customer_reviews.author: Melinda L.

customer_reviews.title: Dust Magnet
customer_reviews.text: No matter what I do, I cannot get this filter cleaned of dust, as these particles stick to the glass from static charge. I also thought the polarization effect could be a little stronger. The glass isn't that impressive either, being similar to cheaper brands such as Vivitar. These same problems go for my other Tiffen filter as well. There are cheaper brands with better glass that don't attract dust. Then adjusting the filter will tend to dismount it from the lens as well. It works okay so it's still a usable filter, but I've been feeling let down from my Tiffen filters as I start exploring other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Alvar

customer_reviews.title: would not screw on lens and stay
customer_reviews.text: I have an older filter, the same one works wonderfully. I wanted this for a second lens. I got the first one and it would screw on but fell off with the least littlest nudge. so I sent it back and when the second one came it did the same thing. I tried it on 2 different lens with the same results. I am returning it and ordering a different one... I am very disappointed in Tiffen, their products are usually much better.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It does work!
customer_reviews.text: I was not exposed to the filters until recently. This is great and it works. doesn't cost much. If you haven't tried a filter, you should definitely try. It does wonders. Update: This is great for controlling reflections when you click pictures of glossy paints(cars), water, glasses, laptop monitors etc. Also, the overall quality of the picture improves a lot(contrasts, highlights, saturations etc) The product quality is very okay, for a starter this product is good to start with. Find it little difficult to put it on the lens. If there was an option I would have rated this 3.5/5.
customer_reviews.author: Britto

customer_reviews.title: Good and Bad
customer_reviews.text: First the good - this polarizer makes for good photos and is priced well. The bad - the serrated edge that is used to tighten the filter is very thin which makes it difficult to remove the filter from your cameras lens or UV filter. I don't use a polarizing filter often and when I do it needs to be "easy-on and easy-off" for quick changes in picture effects. I have an older polarizing filter that mounts/removes easily easily but this Tiffen filter does not. I had ordered the Tiffin for a second camera. I'm replacing it with a slightly larger ProMaster filter
customer_reviews.author: Jim E

customer_reviews.title: Poor Quality
customer_reviews.text: You get what you pay for here... I knew it was probably a gamble. All of the landscape photos I take with this had a pie slice of dark sky, its terrible. I bought this right before a several month long cross-country trip. I should have just spent the extra money and got a proper one because this is in all of my photos. Huge bummer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very Disappointed in What Was Once Known As a Premium Brand
customer_reviews.text: Tiffen used to be considered a relatively premium brand. I purchased this and was not able to use it for several months otherwise I would have easily returned it. The problem that I had was that it was very hard to turn the polarizing element as there was a great deal of friction. You could unscrew it but that is not how it is designed to work. I just got off the phone on hold with TIffen customer service for over an hour and they did not pick up my call. In the big scheme of things this is not a big deal, but I would suggest you look at Breakthrough Photography. Yes you pay more but it works.
customer_reviews.author: pjmsj21

customer_reviews.title: Mold spores permanently damaged
customer_reviews.text: Yes, even though it is a shipping issue it does in fact affect the quality (in this case). My polarizer arrived covered in mold spores. Never would've expected that! I've cleaned it real well and I guess the mold spores have sat on the polarizer so long that it has permanently damaged the glass with little round dots. Really frustrating. I wouldn't buy it if you need a polarizer quickly for a project. Tiffen needs to review how Amazon ships their products.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Well-priced circular polarizer that gives great results
customer_reviews.text: A well-priced circular polarizer that gives great results on my Sony cameras and Tamron lenses. Well worth the money. Posted a few random snaps here to illustrate the rich blue skies up on my mountain. Camera: Sony a55; lens: Tamron SP 10-24mm 3.5-4.5, ISO 100, 1/60th at f8. There's very slight vignetting at the widest setting, but I also have a very thin UV filter on the lens, so that's part of the problem. (I don't want to take it off unless the shot absolutely calls for it.) Looking forward to taking this on our big Newfoundland and Labrador trip and getting some fantastic shots by the sea.
customer_reviews.author: Dr W

customer_reviews.title: Not recommended for use with Canon Vixia R800
customer_reviews.text: The filter works with polarization issues but does not work well with the camcorder's sensor and/or focus. The loss of sharpness is significant. The filter creates a haze effect at times. I blame the filter because the Tiffen UV filter is transparent to the sensor and focal electronics. I bought the Tiffen filter as a trial run because I had concerns with the compatibility of using filters on a camcorder going in.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Coleman

customer_reviews.title: We just returned from Yellowstone. The polarized lens made ...
customer_reviews.text: We just returned from Yellowstone. The polarized lens made a huge improvement over the no filter shots. I compared a couple pictures with and without and the without shots were all washed out. My wife made some simple edits before photo sharing and she said the time was cut way down in part due to the new camera and in part due to the polarized lense. I would absolutely repurchase. If anyone is wondering about the sizes, they relate to the diameter of the lens not the thinkness of the filter (I'm new to photography). The lens on your camera will have the lense diameter printed on it
customer_reviews.author: lordmattbob

customer_reviews.title: Totally worth the buy.
customer_reviews.text: So far this polarizer has come in super handy. It does a fantastic job of giving the sky that beautiful blue color and making it stand out from the clouds. I used this for my brother's graduation and it was a bright sunny day and this polarizer helped me get the beautiful shots I wanted. This also comes quite in handy if you want to shoot with a wide aperture on a bright sunny day, because it automatically lowers the amount of light reaching your camera by a few stops. So basically you can bring your aperture down a little more (without changing any other settings) than you could without.
customer_reviews.author: Crixell

customer_reviews.title: Cirdular Polarizer
customer_reviews.text: Just like the product details describe. The rotation of the polarizer is smooth. Appears to be good quality with no blemishes. Be careful when screwing the filter on and off as aluminum threads on the polarizer when mating with the aluminum threads of the lens body tend to occasionally gall up if not careful. This is typical and problematic of aluminum on aluminum threads. Aluminum is soft and gums up easily especially with mating screw threads. There's no need to tighten this thing anymore than slightly snug. Be careful not to cross thread. Take your time and don't force it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good budget CPL, does the job without major issues.
customer_reviews.text: Not a high end CPL but does its job reasonably well for the cost. Filter rotates easily to adjust the impact, and threads were clean and fit perfectly. Photos are sharp and colors pop as expected with a CPL. The only real issue is that I'm getting flare from the filter at times, looks like typical lens flare. It's not bad, and so far hasn't ruined any images - the flare is in line with bright light sources so it fits the look. Still, when I want a flare I'll add one, but I'd like to be the one determining that. Maybe a lens hood would help that issue. Aside from that, decent CPL for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Vispian

customer_reviews.title: It's okay, not the best, not the worst, but cheaper than others.
customer_reviews.text: It's made in America, which is nice. The quality is just okay though and the ring isn't all that smooth when you turn it. Enough so that it can sometimes start to screw out of the lens mount when you are turning that direction. Lens reviews online show the quality to be middling, but I needed something quick and relatively inexpensive for a recent trip and these fit the bill.
customer_reviews.author: MichaelJ

customer_reviews.title: Just Not For Me
customer_reviews.text: It does what it says. Not a big fan of this one. I know there are better polrizers out there. But I went to a Tiffen meet and they recommended this one so I went with it. Im just stuck in the middle. The quality of the material is great and the case it comes with is great. But I just feel I can't recommend this product to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob L.

customer_reviews.title: Meh.
customer_reviews.text: I'm rather disappointed with the effectiveness of this polarizer. I figured that a brand like Tiffen - although inexpensive - would produce something better. The point is the non-glare percentage/area on the dial is very narrow and everything else is really not affected by turning it. IOW, it's not gradual as it should be. I wouldn't recommend this one.
customer_reviews.author: filmyTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This polarizer works and the effects can be seen through the viewfinder. It offers some protection to the front of the lens and can be used with other filters and shades. A great value for beginners on a budget. This filter does add to contrast when there is a lot of sky in the frame and it may even help with reflection.
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzy Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Moderately polarizing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this CPL filter after reviewing a lot of budget filters. It does work but if you have a wide-angle lens it produces some strange color gradient. The polarization effect is also not very strong. I really had to hunt for the optimal turn to get the best effect and for the price you probably can't do much better. The price reflects the quality of this filter.
customer_reviews.author: anonsan

customer_reviews.title: Defective product
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two filters, one 67mm and one 77mm. As I was getting ready to install them in my lenses, I tried to clean them. I used wipes designed to clean lenses and a micro fiber cloth, but I was not able to have either of the two filters clear. You can see in the pictures tiny dots, they are everywhere on both sides of the filters. These dots will surely have an impact to the picture quality. I do not know why these two filters came defective, but I won't keep them. For the record, I do have a couple other Tiffen filters, but they are clear, no internet dots.
customer_reviews.author: Fman

customer_reviews.title: It does what is supposed to
customer_reviews.text: I feel the need to mention this before anything else, if you're new to photography and you don't know how polarized filters work, you basically twist/spin the front part of the filter in order to increase or decrease the effect on the picture/video image of the camera. This filter works exactly as it is supposed to. I didn't notice any decrease of video quality while using it. So I recommend it to those who want to get rid of reflection, get a bluer sky, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Yass

customer_reviews.title: Good quality, great photos
customer_reviews.text: I'm amazed at the difference this makes. I wasn't quite sold on the idea that a polarizing filter could make that much of a difference, but since I take pictures almost exclusively outdoors I thought I'd give it a shot. As far as I can tell this is a pretty good quality filter, but I don't have anything to compare it to. I am able to get some pretty amazing shots with great saturation using this filter. I often take photos near water, and there is a huge difference in reflections when I use this filter. I think for the price it's hard to beat.
customer_reviews.author: C.

customer_reviews.title: Good price, great quality.
customer_reviews.text: I am not a robot or sponsored in ANYWAY so let that be my first point. This is a really good product for this price. It compares to another I bought on amazon for $20 and both do the job well. I have no problems with it and if you are asking, "How does it compare to the more expensive options?" Let me say. I have not used an expensive filter before, but if this filter is the standard for "bad", it's really good.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommend
customer_reviews.text: I got the 46 millimeter polarizer for my Sony NEX 5R with a 19mm Sigma lens on it. I am huge fan of the Tiffen lens after the 4 shoots I have done with it. The quality of the nature photos I have taken has increased dramatically. I was hesitant about buying this as I didn't want to spend money on an inferior product and then end up paying more down the line for the one I really wanted. As an amateur photographer, I can confidently say that this is a fantastic product and it no way distorts to the image quality.
customer_reviews.author: Chris Meier

customer_reviews.title: Cannot go wrong with Tiffen filters!
customer_reviews.text: Tiffen always makes good products in my opinion. The price was just right for me. As an amateur photographer I do not have tons of money to spend on filters. I find that Tiffen does a great job in providing filters for a good price. The polarize filter I like to use on brighter days for that extra pop of color in my photographers and sometimes I will throw in on over my neutral density filters. It also works great as a protector in general. Metal and glass and sturdy. I have dropped the filter a couple of times already and no damage! I just this for my Nikon7100 long lens.
customer_reviews.author: DTTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Decent modern day filter
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't turn as dark as my old 1970's Spiratone Polarizer but it's ok. Not as high of a contrast between shades. I have had to replace all of my old inexpensive filters because of my new lens size, and because of it being a digital camera. I have noticed that the old inexpensive filter quality is equivalent to the expensive filter quality of today. The cheap filters of today wouldn't have been sold back then. Manufacturers would have never settled for "just ok". I guess we're just living in the age of "marginal" when it comes to quality. OMG....I sound like my Dad!!!!
customer_reviews.author: dm8711

customer_reviews.title: Ok quality but produce dark corners
customer_reviews.text: The filter works as expected, it can get rid of reflections from things like water. But if you use it on lens wider than ~30-35mm, it produces dark corners. I read about this before I bought it but did not pay enough attention. I wish I had paid attention and got a different one.
customer_reviews.author: ML

customer_reviews.title: For the price, this cannot be beat
customer_reviews.text: I feel that this filter and riches the green and blue and white colors in photos. Here are a few shots using the filter, I don’t have much in the way of comparison with or without but it does help especially with reflection over water or on a window. The ring is metal, the glass is made of glass however the threads are plastic, my only disappointment but for the price, I’m not complaining
customer_reviews.author: EA Grimes-Patton

customer_reviews.title: Not Dramatic But Acceptable For the Price
customer_reviews.text: Been using polarizing filters for many years. This is not the most dramatic one I've owned but acceptable for the price and current requirements. Rotating the filter produces subtle differences. Recently bought a 55mm to 300mm zoom lens, which is the only 58mm filter size in my collection. When budget allows, will replace this one.
customer_reviews.author: Alan

customer_reviews.title: 58mm Polarizer for Canon EOS
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing wrong with the filter, but I use a Canon EOS T6 whose lens filters rotate with the focus making a polarizer difficult to use. Every re-focus alters the position of the filter! It's practically useless on my camera and lens. BUT the filter is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Slammajamma

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely zero polarization capability
customer_reviews.text: This filter has absolutely zero polarization effect. No matter how it was rotated you cannot block clear coming off of water or shiny surface. I have been using polarize equipment since 1976 and this product has absolutely no polarization capability.
customer_reviews.author: Facewest

customer_reviews.title: too much friction
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use on a small cam, Sony rx100m3. I find the friction is too high. Since the cam's viewfinder is pretty small you have to align your eye carefully and trying to rotate the filter and see the effect on the sky is difficult. Maybe not an issue on larger cam, dunno.
customer_reviews.author: ft traveler

customer_reviews.title: Nice filter, fits and works as expected
customer_reviews.text: Nice filter, fits and works as expected. However, on my a6000, I have a great deal of trouble removing the filter because it is slim enough that I have trouble getting my fingers against the inner ring to unscrew it. Fingernails help. I normally wouldn't want this, but in this case, the filter ring could benefit from actually being a great deal thicker.
customer_reviews.author: eagle79

customer_reviews.title: Tiffen.. Excellent.
customer_reviews.text: I have used Tiffen filters my entire time as a photographer, from the moment my dad screwed on onto my first camera when I was about eight to this filter, which I bought for a $2,500 lens. The filters always have exceptional clarity and this is no exception. You can find filters for a lot more money than this one, with all kinds of descriptive frills claimed for it. In 50 years of snapping photos, I have never had a second thought about what filter to buy. Tiffen.. Excellent.
customer_reviews.author: Robrt

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly!
customer_reviews.text: This Tiffen Polarizer worked perfectly. I had to photograph a marketing campaign for an outdoor product and the use of this filter helped to dramatically reduce glare on the product while enhancing the deep colors of the sky. Definitely recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: R. Wilson

customer_reviews.title: Good enough for the price
customer_reviews.text: I am using this filter on my everyday carry lens. I previously had a Hoya Pro Multi-coat filter on this lens, but it broke. I wasn't excited about spending $175 on another 77mm CPL, so I gave the Tiffen a shot. While I don't have a quantitative set of comparisons between the two, my impression is the Tiffen is not capable producing the same results as the Hoya. But, the results are good enough. I'm taking candids of my family, high school sports, and vacation snapshots, not producing high art.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Cloninger

customer_reviews.title: Great for water pics
customer_reviews.text: I have been practicing using this and it works well with water. Took some great pics of the clear water on Catalina. The issue I have is when turning the lens aimed at the blue sky it makes an unattractive blue blotch sometimes.... this definitely could be user error though since I’m still learning and have not used any other polarized lens to compare it with. Very happy with the water pics though!
customer_reviews.author: gm

customer_reviews.title: It’s a good polarizer filter for the price
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good polarizer, I bought it because I’m starting with a Sony a7II, it works very well for the price I have seen better ones on YouTube but the price of those are $140 and this one for the price is really good! So I recommend it if you are starting, just to go above the basic package, the autofocus with this filter have a little trouble to get it done, but you can work a little bit with your aperture and speed to get better results ( this works for me) I shoot this pictures with a 50mm f1.8 at 1/250 f1.8 I keep the same speed and aperture so you can have an idea of the changes
customer_reviews.author: Octavio Jaidar

customer_reviews.title: I can't get pictures to come out right with it
customer_reviews.text: I gave it three stars instead of one, because it honestly could be user error, but I cannot get pictures to come out right with this lens. Maybe it would work better with landscape shots, but I primarily use my camera to take portraits of my son (just turned one), and every time I used this on the lens I couldn't get my settings adjusted to wear things wouldn't come out too dark.
customer_reviews.author: Booknerd28Top Contributor: Baby

customer_reviews.title: Broke after less than 1 yr with minimal use
customer_reviews.text: It Broke after less than 1 year and minimal use. Can not recommend due to this fact
customer_reviews.author: Ahuewave

customer_reviews.title: Was concerned about the price but very happy.
customer_reviews.text: This is my first polaizer lens and I'm very happy with it. I almost went with a more expensive option but thought I'd give this a try. I had to film a scene of a person inside a car with the camera mounted on the hood and it performed very well. Overall very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: Captain Meatball

customer_reviews.title: Trouble with Canon 24-105 lens
customer_reviews.text: The quality of the glass is good, but I'm only giving 2 stars because on a 24-105 Canon L lens the filter aluminum edge shows up in the pictures at the widest angle. An easy fix would to zoom in slightly but that defeats the purpose. Had to return it due to many images with dark corners from the filter.
customer_reviews.author: N. Tucci

customer_reviews.title: Everyone needs a Polarizer
customer_reviews.text: Does its job as a polarizer. It doesn't add a noticeable color or tint that I've noticed. even if it did it would be easy to correct in Photoshop with a colorchecker. Polarizers are great for getting rid of reflections in water, metal, glass, windows. You can spin it and see the intensity it can bring back into the sky, also can show texture in an object, remove reflections off the ground or reflections in someones glasses. Bottom line is everyone could use this in their kit! Fits perfectly on my Canon 24-105L
customer_reviews.author: Cheap Date

customer_reviews.title: Good lens, not too much polarizer
customer_reviews.text: Very good polarizer for my 24-70 lens. My exact same lens cracked for reasons unclear to me, and this was an emergency order to protect this very expensive lens. It fits exactly and is the right meter of polarizer. I will be more careful (I did have the lens cap on so don't know what happened to the old one.) Perhaps not to stuff it in a bag with anything sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Ngirilover

customer_reviews.title: I go out of my way to use this rather than my more expensive B+W filters! Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This thing always catches me off guard, I bought this one as a cheap backup for my B+W polarizers, and then I prefer to use this one anyways because the colors are better, and it has a wider polarizing range! I go out of my way to attach this one to my lenses instead of the $50 more expensive B+W ones. That's a good product review right there if anything!
customer_reviews.author: Elliott Golden

customer_reviews.title: Good value for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Very good and filter for my camera. Works as advertised by reducing glare. Took on a trip to Alaska and to the Caribbean. Pictures taken were beautiful. The polarizing affect worked wonderfully on the Clear water of the Caribbean.
customer_reviews.author: Janet Cunningham

customer_reviews.title: Great quality
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I have used a polarizer but I am quite impressed. The only difficulty for me is remembering to adjust the polarization every time but that's on me, not the item itself. This is worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Simply OK
customer_reviews.text: For the price it is just OK, I have been using Tiffen for a long time and have become accustomed to their high quality standards. Unfortunately this one simply gets the OK rating. it does not turn smooth. in fact it has a few rough spots when you turn the filter. The glass is good, the mechanics not so much. hope this helps.
customer_reviews.author: nick goymerac

customer_reviews.title: Awesome Polarizer for the buck!!!
customer_reviews.text: This polarizer is probably the only polarizer I need. No more overpaying for polarizers, if you are someone like me who can't spend a fortune on camera gear this is the perfect polarizer for you. No more glare in photos no more nothing. This polarizer makes a fellow photographer's photos look super crisp, and there is no glare bothering the person that is viewing these photos. Ever since I purchased this polarizer it has been a game-changer, my photos have been very crisp. Thank to this polarizer for saving me money and making my photo quality go up!!!
customer_reviews.author: David B

customer_reviews.title: Awesome filter! Great for real estate photographers and glare.
customer_reviews.text: Using this primarily for real estate photography to cut glares out of floors. Works super well especially for window cast on wood floors. Also deepens the blues really nicely. Don’t really see a loss of sharpness, really inexpensive for what it does. Using it with my canon 5d Mark iv and a 16-35!
customer_reviews.author: Andrei Restrepo

customer_reviews.title: IT'S LOOKING AT ME... UNUSED
customer_reviews.text: It was too cheap to send back... or I would. As a photographer with two cameras, a wife and a dog to support I expect everything to work as advertised. I've used Tiffen for decades. This is the first filter that does nothing.
customer_reviews.author: Mike A.

customer_reviews.title: A great and affordable polarized lens
customer_reviews.text: I use this lens to film videos and take pictures at the beach. The lens really brings out the color of the beach and cuts glare letting me film or shoot pictures of what is in the ocean, fish or coral.
customer_reviews.author: Coconut eater

customer_reviews.title: LOVE this polarizer. Durable and does it's job flawlessly
customer_reviews.text: This polarizer is so beautiful! I got it for the protection of my lens, but it also makes the colors more vivid and brighter. It is very reflective (so you cannot see the interior part like the shutter). I actually captured a photo of a sunset reflecting off my polarizer and it was a unique and beautiful shot! Tiffen is amazing quality as well, I would recommend 100%
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: WORKS GREAT FOR ME
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't justify $100 or more for another brand. I am not going into hot dusty deserts or steamy jungles so this works just fine for me in local state parks. My pictures look beautiful on my Nikon D3300 and I am very picky about the way a picture should look so I am very happy. If you are going to be in very harsh conditions when you photograph then yes you probably might need super multi coating and hard metal super duper metal casings but bring $100-$300 to pay for the filters.
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Raspy tuning
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited about this but once I took it out of the box and placed it on it and spinning the ring it sounds like raspy and rough. Like when you have pieces of sand between a bottle cap and bottle. I would like a replace ment and I will be more then happy to change my rating
customer_reviews.author: Juan Ventura

customer_reviews.title: A must have for the serious photographer.
customer_reviews.text: The filter has the Tiffen traditional quality at a very good price, It's not Multi coated and that makes it a breeze to clean, plus the ring shows no play...a perfect fit I say. If you are worried about glare, use a lens hood and when shooting, changing your angle of view can possibly eliminate the problem. Remember this filter is made essentially to eliminate reflections indoors or outdoors, and to darken sky's by turning the outer ringI.If you are not a Pro, and are on a budget, and still want results....this is the filter for you. Thanks Tiffen!
customer_reviews.author: Lee G.

customer_reviews.title: This polarizer lens works great for direct sunlight photos without creating flairs in photos
customer_reviews.text: This polarizer lens works great for direct sunlight photos without creating flairs in photos. Have been extremely impressed with picture quality since using this lens. I'm able to take shots anytime of the day anywhere without worrying about issue with my camera sensor. It's a must have for those wanting a quality polarizer without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: L Photographer

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: This lense is more poralized than the american people! 11/10, would take more photos with this lense again
customer_reviews.author: Scott

customer_reviews.title: Be careful when you thread
customer_reviews.text: I should preface this by saying that the filter does it's job well. With that said, the Tiffen filter, with it's two piece design, can be difficult to get lined up and threaded correctly on your lens. I don't have this problem with Hoya filters. I have come close to getting a filter stuck on a lens two or three times already. Not sure if this a Canon issue or if Nikon lenses have the same issue. The filter itself is very effective once on the lens.
customer_reviews.author: Troy W.

customer_reviews.title: Makes a big difference in my photos!
customer_reviews.text: I use this type of filter on all my lenses. It makes a big difference to my mind. I like the deeper colors and haze reduction it gives. While it is an excellent product, when I screwed it on over my UV lens (my method) - it seemed a bit tight. It's still new and maybe it just needs to be rotated some more? Or is it just secure from moving once you set it? I found that as far as performance, it was just fine. I don't generally mess with it once I set it. Otherwise, great product and for me no problems. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jo Grazide

customer_reviews.title: A quality filter and 1/2 the price of others
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a quality filter and 1/2 the price of others. This fits the Panasonic MFT 10x 14-140mm F3.5 lens with no issue. Cheap protection. The 1st lens accessory I always purchase for a lens.
customer_reviews.author: videobruce

customer_reviews.title: great colors, good price.
customer_reviews.text: Polarizers are surpisingly expensive, with the nicest ones ranging up to or even over 100 dollars... this one, at right around 20$ seems just about right. I get nice deep blue sky colors with it, deeper greens, and that cool transparent/anti reflection/glare effect shooting into water, which is just what i wanted. I really don't plan on using it all that much, so anything more expensive just would not have been worth it to me. That being said, I'm not sure how big of a quality difference in image quality there might be between a filter of this price and some of the more expensive ones, but for me this one is just perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: THE TIFFEN POLARIZER
customer_reviews.text: One of my all time favorite filters will always be the polarizer! I bought this one for my new 67mm lens and it works like ones I had for my 58mm kit lens. Another good purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Marvin D. Martian

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: Polarizing is great. But I think I got a defective one. As the CPL i received , the two elements come apart.
customer_reviews.author: Jesse Cool

customer_reviews.title: At worst, it's a lens protector
customer_reviews.text: The difference is very slight, but for the price I have no complaints. This is even cheaper than a lens protector, and it has a little bit of UV polarization thrown in free of charge!
customer_reviews.author: CPU enthusiast

customer_reviews.title: My Go 2 Brand - Tiffen - the Consistency Never Disappoints
customer_reviews.text: Tiffen, being among the handful of major filter brands, has never let me down, the consistency from year to year is spot on. All filters impact the f/stop to some degree, and Tiffen's filters are consistent from year to year, making my photographic calculations more intuitive. My order was promptly processes and delivered as promised.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Burgess

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to set.
customer_reviews.text: The filter is mediocre and it is very, very difficult to distinguish when you should stop turning it. When you do it correctly, the sky is blue as it should.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique Bozzo

customer_reviews.title: Good quality for the price.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a good filter but keep in mind that using in a 77mm lenses with wide angle you well have some very rude shadows in your image. Better use in like 58mm lenses with step ups. For 77 lenses I bought a 82mm and use a step up.
customer_reviews.author: ThgLmbrg

customer_reviews.title: Very Nice for the Money
customer_reviews.text: Good Quality and affordable. You can definitely notice the difference, the saturation in the sky (beautiful blue ) when taking a photo with this.
customer_reviews.author: LUKE S.

customer_reviews.title: I had to change my review from 5 stars to 1 star because the 3rd Tiffen filter I bough is terrible.
customer_reviews.text: I have been using filters for years and had many Tiffen filters with no complaints, in fact my last review was 5 stars. The last filter I bough for my Sony A6000 a 40.5mm CPL is a useless piece of junk, I am even more upset cause half of my pictures are all bad beyond saving. The filter causes asymmetric lighting over the image, it causes vignetting and in many cases the images are just too dark. Instead of bringing up the colors the filter almost washes out the colors. I took over 500 pics on my last trip about half are total garbage. I will never buy Tiffen again I will pay more money but get something better.
customer_reviews.author: Izak K.

customer_reviews.title: Great polarized lens
customer_reviews.text: Using this filter on Sigma 16 mm lens. One has to make sure it is screwed on well. Sometimes it loosens with the hood on. Other than that happy with item.
customer_reviews.author: ZenFloyd

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a great filter for the price. I've tried others that were less expensive and they worked that way, cheap. This is a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Viki

customer_reviews.title: Rare problem
customer_reviews.text: Tiffen is great. Love their stuff, but was really confused when my 82mm pole didn't really work. It just changed the color slightly.. The glass was installed backwards. I unscrewed the retaining ring and flipped it. All good.. So, if you get one that seems to be weird, that's probably the reason...
customer_reviews.author: rotorshawn

customer_reviews.title: Gritty and greasy
customer_reviews.text: The one I received must have been missed by quality control. There is a lubricant seemingly leaking from the seam where the lens rotates. Rotating the lens feels and sounds gritty. I attached it to my camera lens and the picture quality was nice, the polarizer worked nicely as I expected. After testing, immediately removed it from my lens, wiped away more grease/oil, not wanting it leaking anywhere near my lens! I purchased this brand based on other reviews, but definitely didn't receive a quality item.
customer_reviews.author: LeAnne

customer_reviews.title: Great filter at reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: Tiffen makes good products - I was very happy with my polarizing filter, good glass and well machined. Met or exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.author: Ross J. Mehan

customer_reviews.title: just use a rubber band to give you some better grip and it will come off
customer_reviews.text: Does what it say it will. Can get stuck on the lens but the threads are smooth and if it does get stuck, just use a rubber band to give you some better grip and it will come off.
customer_reviews.author: Ron

customer_reviews.title: Reduce the quality of your photo
customer_reviews.text: Reduce the sharpness and not remove the reflections well and there's some dark areas
customer_reviews.author: Diaa E.

customer_reviews.title: The ring is too high for wide angle lenses.
customer_reviews.text: Optically is not too bad it is comparable to OEM of camera manufacturers but the ring is too thick it showed in the image at the corners in the form of a vignette on wide lenses.
customer_reviews.author: Ocean

customer_reviews.title: Pretty lens for the price
customer_reviews.text: Not a photography expert by any means but could definitely see a difference in this lens's ability to remove water reflections from my standard lens. Took a few pictures of my front deck on a rainy day and could see a pretty big difference. Can't wait to see what it can do with landscape and automotive photography.
customer_reviews.author: William

customer_reviews.title: The filter works better than I expected
customer_reviews.text: The filter works better than I expected. It makes the colors pop and with only slightly darker exposure. I experienced one problem due to operator error. As it is a CPL and you have to turn the filter, do not turn it counter-clockwise. You will unscrew it and it will fall off your lens. Trust me, they don't like concrete. This is a replacement purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Teresa

customer_reviews.title: Does absolutely nothing that I could tell.
customer_reviews.text: Was hoping this would help with glare, etc. but my photos look exactly the same with and without it. Such a waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Gagagaga

customer_reviews.title: Cheal filter, and it shows.
customer_reviews.text: After buying this and several other low-end filters (to save a buck), I have become a convert to getting the best possible filters. The old adage really holds: why put a dirty window in front of a masterpiece. Best to not use a filter if possible, but if you want to use one (a polarizer can be very useful) then get one that measures up the quality of your lens. If you have spent $1000 - $2000 on a lens, why waste it by using a cheap filter.
customer_reviews.author: RuthZ

customer_reviews.title: Great price
customer_reviews.text: My daughter was using my last circular filter and accidentally unscrewed it and dropped it in Monterey Bay. Glad I got another for such a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Evin D Planto

customer_reviews.title: Good inexpensive polarizer
customer_reviews.text: I'm not all that experienced with polarizers, but this one works well and is easy to handle (it turns easily and smoothly and stays in place). The only downside is that it is prone to lens flare (which isn't much a problem because for the polarizer to be useful you kinda need to be shooting at roughly 90deg to the sun). I do get the sense that a better polarizer would have a stronger effect, but I'm actually VERY happy with the pictures I get with this, so I'm not complaining. Overall great for the price. I'm sure there are better filters, but I'm happy with this one.
customer_reviews.author: A. Peters

customer_reviews.title: Great Lens Filter for the Money! Makes filming in the bright sun so much easier!
customer_reviews.text: Great lens filter for the money. I did some research before I jumped right in to buying a cheaper one and the reviews all pointed toward the Tiffen. So far it has not let me down. I would definitely suggest it to any other filmmakers having problems with that blinding mid day sun.
customer_reviews.author: Ben Edwards III

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable for a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Cheap polarizer works reasonably well. I used one for quite a while and replaced it after several years due to some scratches (happy it's not the lens!). I use it pretty much all the time when outdoors. Price went down quite a bit since i bought the first one.
customer_reviews.author: Philip M.Top Contributor: Arduino

customer_reviews.title: Bought it to use it for ocean water shots
customer_reviews.text: We went to Hawaii to see the whales and I wanted a polarizing filter to reduce the glare. This filter did the trick. Not having used one before, it took a little practice and trial-and-error to work out what looks good. The cost was a big factor for me and this one performs will for the price. I found it doesn't work well for sunsets over the ocean, I kept getting light streaks. I figured this was due to using a polarized filter which just isn't appropriate for that situation. I got some really great pictures of the whales and glad I got this filter.
customer_reviews.author: H. T. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Probably good, but bad QC
customer_reviews.text: I wish I could’ve used it, but the one I received in the mail was scratched and opened... I bought it “new” but looked used. If it was indeed new then there was a scratch/ding on the surrounding bezel. The lens also had a lot of white specks on it.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Defective
customer_reviews.text: I have always had good luck with Tiffen but something is wrong with this. It is loose and rattles around. It gets the job done but is defective
customer_reviews.author: ben

customer_reviews.title: Make Blue Skies Beautiful
customer_reviews.text: Been using professional Tiffen filters for fifty years. There is no better on the market. This circular polarizer is necessary to improve contrast outdoors with electronic image cameras. You can't fix it post if you don't capture the image properly.
customer_reviews.author: Moviela

customer_reviews.title: If you shoot photos outdoors, this filter needs to ...
customer_reviews.text: If you shoot photos outdoors, this filter needs to be attached to the end of your lens. The polarizer darkens blue skies (if the sky is light blue, you get deep, rich blue) and eleminates glare and reflection in glass and water. I use this filter primarily when taking pictures of cars. It removes any reflections in the paint of the car/ windows and exposes the sky at the same time. A definite must have. Keep in mind that this polarizer will make your image darker so if shooting in lower light be sure to use a tripod.
customer_reviews.author: Rudy

customer_reviews.title: Creates uneven filter effects.
customer_reviews.text: I have used this filter with my Sony 70-200 2.8 for portraits and landscapes and it is descent but creates some strange effects that I can correct in photoshop. It causes uneven effects in the images.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.J

customer_reviews.title: Great filter
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with Tiffen lenses and have won photo awards using them. Great product and made in USA!
customer_reviews.author: Oldies Guy

product_meta.title: Tiffen 77CP 77mm Circular Polarizer
product_meta.description:
Size:77mm| Configuration:Circular PolarizerEssential for outdoor photography Deepens intensity of blue skies Reduces or eliminates glare 77mm diameter Circular construction.

AMAZON.COM
A circular polarizer has the same effect as a polarizer and is used on cameras with beam- splitting metering systems commonly found on autofocus SLRs.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,164 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
